asset_img_url.description: Returns the asset URL of an image in the "assets" folder of a theme. asset_img_url accepts an image size parameter.

asset_url.description: Returns the URL of a file in the "assets" folder of a theme.

currency_selector.description: Generates a drop-down list that customers can use to select an accepted currency on your storefront. This filter must be used on the form object within a currency form

parameters.name: class
parameters.description: The class name to be applied

customer_login_link.description: Generates a link to the customer login page.

file_img_url.description: Returns the URL of an image in the Files page of the admin. file_img_url accepts an image size parameter.

file_url.description: Returns the URL of a file in the Files page of the admin.

font_face.description: Returns a CSS @font-face declaration to load the chosen font

parameters.name: font_display
parameters.description: The font-display descriptor determines how a font face is displayed based on whether and when it is downloaded and ready to use

accepts.name: auto
accepts.description: The font display strategy is defined by the user agent.

accepts.name: block
accepts.description: Gives the font face a short block period and an infinite swap period.

accepts.name: swap
accepts.description: Gives the font face an extremely small block period and an infinite swap period.

accepts.name: fallback
accepts.description: Gives the font face an extremely small block period and a short swap period.

accepts.name: optional
accepts.description: Gives the font face an extremely small block period and no swap period.

font_modify.description: font_modify takes two arguments. The first indicates which property should be modified and the second is the modification to be made.

accepts.name: normal
accepts.description: Returns the normal variant of the same weight (if it exists).

accepts.name: italic
accepts.description: Returns the italic variant of the same weight (if it exists)..

accepts.name: oblique
accepts.description: Has the same behavior as italic. None of the font families provided by Shopify have both italic and oblique styles.

accepts.name: lighter
accepts.description: Returns a lighter variant of the same style by applying the rules used by the CSS font-weight property and browser fallback weights (if it exists).

accepts.name: bolder
accepts.description: Returns a bolder variant of the same style by applying the rules used by the CSS font-weight property and browser fallback weights (if it exists).
Returns a variant of the same style with the given weight (if it exists).

Returns an incrementally bolder font of the same style (if it exists). For example, if font has a weight of 400, then font | font_modify "weight", "+100" returns the variant with a weight of 500 for the same style.

Returns an incrementally lighter font of the same style (if it exists). For example, if font has a weight of 400, then font | font_modify "weight", "-100" returns the variant with a weight of 300 for the same style.

font_url.description: Returns a CDN URL for the chosen font. By default, font_url returns the woff2 version, but it can also be called with an additional parameter to specify the format. Both woff and woff2 are supported.

global_asset_url.description: Returns the URL of a global asset. Global assets are kept in a central directory on Shopifyâ€™s servers. Using global assets can improve the load times of your pages.

img_url.description: Returns the URL of an image. Accepts an image size as a parameter.

link_to.description: Generates an HTML link. The first parameter is the URL of the link, and the optional second parameter is the title of the link.

link_to_add_tag.description: Creates a link to all products in a collection that have a given tag as well as any tags that have been already selected.

link_to_remove_tag.description: Generates a link to all products in a collection that have the given tag and all the previous tags that might have been added already.

link_to_tag.description: Creates a link to all products in a collection that have a given tag.

link_to_type.description: Creates an HTML link to a collection page that lists all products belonging to a product type.

link_to_vendor.description: Creates an HTML link to a collection page that lists all products belonging to a vendor.

money.description: Formats the price based on the shopâ€™s `HTML without currency` setting

money_with_currency.description: Formats the price based on the shopâ€™s `HTML with currency` setting.

money_without_currency.description: Formats the price using a decimal.

money_without_trailing_zeros.description: Formats the price based on the shopâ€™s `HTML with currency` setting and excludes the decimal point and trailing zeros.

payment_button.description: Creates a dynamic checkout button for a product. This filter must be used on the form object within a product form.

payment_type_img_url.description: Returns the URL of the payment typeâ€™s SVG image. Used in conjunction with the shop.enabled_payment_types variable.

payment_type_svg_tag.description: Returns the `<svg>` tag of the requested payment type image for inlining purposes. Used in conjunction with the `shop.enabled_payment_types` variable.

shopify_asset_url.description: Returns the URL of a global assets that are found on Shopifyâ€™s servers.

sort_by.description: Creates a URL to a collection page with the provided sort_by parameter. This filter must be applied to a collection URL.

stylesheet_tag.description: Generates a link tag that points to the given stylesheet.

url_for_type.description: Creates a URL that links to a collection page containing products with a specific product type.

url_for_vendor.description: Creates a URL that links to a collection page containing products with a specific product vendor.

within.description: Creates a collection-aware product URL by prepending /collections/collection-handle to a product URL, where collection-handle is the handle of the collection that is currently being viewed.

additional_checkout_buttons.description: The content_for_layout object is required in theme.liquid. It must be placed inside the HTML <body> tag. It dynamically loads content generated by other templates such as index.liquid or product.liquid.

address.description: The address object contains information entered by a customer in Shopify's checkout pages.

properties.description: Returns the abbreviated value of the Province/State field of the address.
properties.name: province_code

properties.description: Returns the combined values of the Address1 and Address2 fields of the address.
properties.name: street

properties.description: Returns the relative URL of the address.
properties.name: ref

properties.description: Returns the value of the Address1 field of the address.
properties.name: address1

properties.description: Returns the value of the Address2 field of the address.
properties.name: address2

properties.description: Returns the value of the City field of the address.
properties.name: city

properties.description: Returns the value of the Company field of the address.
properties.name: company

properties.description: Returns the value of the Country field of the address in ISO 3166-2 standard format.
properties.name: country_code

properties.description: Returns the value of the Country field of the address.
properties.name: country

properties.description: Returns the value of the First Name field of the address.
properties.name: first_name

properties.description: Returns the value of the Last Name field of the address.
properties.name: last_name

properties.description: Returns the value of the Phone field of the address.
properties.name: phone

properties.description: Returns the value of the Postal/Zip field of the address.
properties.name: zip

properties.description: Returns the value of the Province/State field of the address.
properties.name: province

properties.description: Returns the values of the First Name and Last Name fields of the address.
properties.name: name

all_country_option_tags.description: The all_country_option_tags object creates an <option> tag for each country. An attribute called data-provinces is set for each <option>, and contains a JSON-encoded array of the country's subregions. If a country doesn't have any subregions, then an empty array is set for its data-provinces attribute.

all_products.description: Returns a list of all the products in your store. You can use all_products to access products by their handles.

article.description: Returns a list of all the blog articles in a store.

properties.description: Returns all the tags for the article.
properties.name: tags

properties.description: Returns an object with information about the article's author.
properties.name: user

properties.description: Returns the bio of the author of the article.
properties.name: bio

properties.description: Returns the email of the author of the article.
properties.name: email

properties.description: Returns the first name of the author of the article.
properties.name: first_name

properties.description: Returns the home page of the article author.
properties.name: homepage

properties.description: Returns the image object of the author of the article.
properties.name: image

properties.description: Returns the article image's alt text.
properties.name: alt

properties.description: Returns the relative URL to the article image.
properties.name: src

properties.description: Returns the last name of the author of the article.
properties.name: last_name

properties.description: Returns true if the author of the article is the account owner of the store. Returns false if the author is not the account owner.
properties.name: account_owner

properties.description: Returns article.excerpt of the article if it exists. Returns article.content if an excerpt does not exist for the article.
properties.name: excerpt_or_content

properties.description: Returns the article's image object.
properties.name: image

properties.description: Returns the article image's alt text.
properties.name: alt

properties.description: Returns the relative URL to the article image.
properties.name: src

properties.description: Returns the content of the article.
properties.name: content

properties.description: Returns the excerpt of the article.
properties.name: excerpt

properties.description: Returns the full name of the article's author.
properties.name: author

properties.description: Returns the handle of the article.
properties.name: handle

properties.description: Returns the id of the article.
properties.name: id

properties.description: Returns the number of published comments for the article.
properties.name: comments_count

properties.description: Returns the published comments of the article. Returns an empty array if comments are disabled.
properties.name: comments

properties.description: Returns the relative URL of the article.
properties.name: ref

properties.description: Returns the relative URL where POST requests are sent to when creating new comments.
properties.name: comment_post_url

properties.description: Returns the timestamp of when the article was created. Use the date filter to format the timestamp.
properties.name: created_at

properties.description: Returns the title of the article.
properties.name: title

properties.description: Returns true if comments are enabled. Returns false if comments are disabled.
properties.name: comments_enabled

properties.description: Returns true if the blog that the article belongs to is set to moderate comments. Returns false if the blog is not moderated.
properties.name: moderated

block.description: A block represents the content and settings of a single block in an array of section blocks. The block object can be accessed in a section file by looping through section.blocks.

properties.description: Returns a string representing the block's attributes.
properties.name: shopify_attributes

properties.description: Returns a unique ID dynamically generated by Shopify.
properties.name: id

properties.description: Returns an object of the block settings set in the theme editor. Retrieve setting values by referencing the setting's unique id.
properties.name: settings

properties.description: Returns the type defined in the block's schema. This is useful for displaying different markup based on the block.type.
properties.name: type

properties.description: Returns all tags in a blog. Similar to all_tags, but only returns tags of articles that are in the filtered view.
properties.name: tags

properties.description: Returns all tags of all articles of a blog. This includes tags of articles that are not in the current pagination view.
properties.name: all_tags

properties.description: Returns an array of all articles in a blog.
properties.name: articles

properties.description: Returns the handle of the blog.
properties.name: handle

properties.description: Returns the id of the blog.
properties.name: id

properties.description: Returns the next (older) article. Returns nil if there is no next article.
properties.name: next_article

properties.description: Returns the previous (newer) article. Returns nil if there is no next article.
properties.name: previous_article

properties.description: Returns the relative URL of the blog.
properties.name: ref

properties.description: Returns the title of the blog.
properties.name: title

properties.description: Returns the total number of articles in a blog. This total does not include hidden articles.
properties.name: articles_count

properties.description: Returns true if comments are enabled, or false if they are disabled.
properties.name: comments_enabled

properties.description: Returns true if comments are moderated, or false if they are not moderated.
properties.name: moderated

canonical_url.description: Returns the canonical URL of the current page. A page's canonical URL is the page's default URL without any URL parameters. For products and variants, the canonical URL is the default product page with no collection or variant selected.

properties.description: Cart attributes allow the capturing of more information on the cart page.
properties.name: attributes

properties.description: Returns all of the line items in the cart.
properties.name: items

properties.description: Returns an array of any cart-specific discount applications for the cart.
properties.name: cart_level_discount_applications

properties.description: Returns an array of discount applications for the cart.
properties.name: discount_applications

properties.description: Returns the currency of the cart. If your store uses multi-currency, then the cart.currency is the same as the customer's local (presentment) currency. Otherwise, the cart currency is the same as your store currency.
properties.name: currency

properties.description: Returns the number of items inside the cart.
properties.name: item_count

properties.description: Returns the subtotal of the cart before any discounts have been applied.
properties.name: original_total_price

properties.description: Returns the sum of the cart's line-item prices after any line-item discount. The subtotal doesn't include taxes (unless taxes are included in the prices), cart discounts, or shipping costs.
properties.name: items_subtotal_price

properties.description: Returns the total of all discounts (the amount saved) for the cart.
properties.name: total_discount

properties.description: Returns the total price of all of the items in the cart after discounts have been applied.
properties.name: total_price

properties.description: Returns the total weight of all of the items in the cart.
properties.name: total_weight

properties.description: cart.note allows the capturing of more information on the cart page.
properties.name: note

properties.description: Returns a list of all product tags in a collection. collection.all_tags will return the full list of tags even when the collection view is filtered. collection.all_tags will return at most 1,000 tags
properties.name: all_tags

properties.description: Returns a list of all product types in a collection
properties.name: all_types

properties.description: Returns a list of all product vendors in a collection.
properties.name: all_vendors

properties.description: Returns all of the products in a collection. You can show a maximum of 50 products per page. Use the paginate tag to choose how many products are shown per page
properties.name: products

properties.description: Returns an array of sorting options for the collection
properties.name: sort_options

properties.description: Returns the ID number of the collection.
properties.name: id

properties.description: Returns the URL of the collection
properties.name: ref

properties.description: Returns the collection's handle
properties.name: handle

properties.description: Returns the date and time when the collection was published. You can set this information on the collection's page in your Shopify admin by the Set publish date calendar icon. You can use a date filter to format the date
properties.name: published_at

properties.description: Returns the description of the collection
properties.name: description

properties.description: Returns the image of the collection
properties.name: image

properties.description: Returns the name of the custom collection template assigned to the `collection`, without the collection. prefix or the `.liquid` extension. Returns `nil` if a custom template is not assigned to the collection.
properties.name: template_suffix

properties.description: Returns the next product in the collection. Returns `nil` if there is no next product
properties.name: next_product

properties.description: Returns the number of products in a collection that match the current view. For example, if you are viewing a collection filtered by tag, collection.`products_count` will return the number of products that match the chosen tag.
properties.name: products_count

properties.description: Returns the number of products in a collection. collection.all_products_count will return the total number of products even when the collection view is filtered.
properties.name: all_products_count

properties.description: Returns the previous product in the collection. Returns `nil` if there is no previous product.
properties.name: previous_product

properties.description: Returns the product type on a `/collections/types?q=TYPE` collection page. For example, you may be on the automatic Shirts collection, which lists all products of type â€˜shirtsâ€™ in the store: `myshop.shopify.com/collections/types?q=Shirts`
properties.name: current_type

properties.description: Returns the sort order applied to the collection by the `sort_by` URL parameter. When there is no `sort_by` URL parameter, the value is null.
properties.name: sort_by

properties.description: Returns the sort order of the collection, which is set in the collection pages of the Admin
properties.name: default_sort_by

properties.description: Returns the tags of products in a collection that match the current view. For example, if you are viewing a collection filtered by tag, `collection.tags` will return the tags for the products that match the current filter
properties.name: tags

properties.description: Returns the title of the collection
properties.name: title

properties.description: Returns the vendor name on a `/collections/vendors?q=VENDOR` collection page. For example, you may be on the automatic Shopify collection, which lists all products with vendor â€˜shopifyâ€™ in the store: `myshop.shopify.com/collections/vendors?q=Shopify`
properties.name: current_vendor

collections.description: Returns a list of all of the collections in a store

properties.description: Returns the URL of the article with `comment.id` appended to it. This is so the page will automatically scroll to the comment
properties.name: ref

properties.description: Returns the author of the comment
properties.name: author

properties.description: Returns the content of the comment
properties.name: content

properties.description: Returns the e-mail address of the comment's author
properties.name: email

properties.description: Returns the id (unique identifier) of the comment
properties.name: id

properties.description: Returns the status of the comment
properties.name: status

properties.description: Returns the timestamp of when the comment was submitted. Use the `date` filter to convert the timestamp into a more readable format
properties.name: created_at

properties.description: Returns the timestamp of when the comment's status was last changed. For example, the timestamp of when a comment was approved by the article's author. Use the `date` filter to convert the timestamp into a more readable format
properties.name: updated_at

content_for_additional_checkout_buttons.description: Returns checkout buttons for any active payment providers with offsite checkouts. The "additional_checkout_buttons" and "content_for_additional_checkout_buttons" are used in many Shopify themes.

content_for_header.description: The content_for_header object is required in theme.liquid. It must be placed inside the HTML <head> tag. It dynamically loads all scripts required by Shopify into the document head. These scripts include Shopify analytics, Google Analytics, and scripts required for Shopify apps.

content_for_index.description: The content_for_index object contains the content of dynamic sections to be rendered on the home page. This object must be included in templates/index.liquid.

content_for_layout.description: The content_for_layout object is required in theme.liquid. It must be placed inside the HTML <body> tag. It dynamically loads content generated by other templates such as index.liquid or product.liquid.

country_option_tags.description: The country_option_tags object creates an <option> tag for each country that is included as a shipping zone on the Shipping page of the admin. An attribute called data-provinces is set for each <option>, and contains a JSON-encoded array of the country's subregions. If a country doesn't have any subregions, then an empty array is set for its data-provinces attribute

properties.description: Returns the ISO code of the currency (for example `USD` or `EUR`).
properties.name: iso_code

properties.description: Returns the currency's symbol (for example, `$` or `â‚¬`).
properties.name: symbol

properties.description: Returns the name of the currency (for example United States dollars or Euro).
properties.name: name

current_page.description: current_page returns the number of the page you are on when browsing through paginated content. It can be used outside the paginate block

current_tags.description: Product tags are used to filter a collection to only show products that contain a specific product tag. Similarly, article tags are used to filter a blog to only show products that contain a specific article tag. The current_tags variable is an array that contains all tags that are being used to filter a collection or blog.

customer.description: The customer object contains information about a customer who has a customer account

properties.description: Returns `true` if the customer accepts marketing, returns `false` if the customer does not
properties.name: accepts_marketing

properties.description: Returns an array of all addresses associated with a customer
properties.name: addresses

properties.description: Returns an array of all orders placed by the customer
properties.name: orders

properties.description: Returns the default customer_address
properties.name: default_address

properties.description: Returns the email address of the customer
properties.name: email

properties.description: Returns the first name of the customer
properties.name: first_name

properties.description: Returns the full name of the customer
properties.name: name

properties.description: Returns the id of the customer
properties.name: id

properties.description: Returns the last name of the customer
properties.name: last_name

properties.description: Returns the last order placed by the customer, not including test orders
properties.name: last_order

properties.description: Returns the list of tags associated with the customer
properties.name: tags

properties.description: Returns the number of addresses associated with a customer
properties.name: addresses_count

properties.description: Returns the phone number of the customer
properties.name: phone

properties.description: Returns the total amount spent on all orders
properties.name: total_spent

properties.description: Returns the total number of orders a customer has placed
properties.name: orders_count

properties.description: Returns true if the email associated with an order is also tied to a customer account. Returns `false` if it is not. Helpful in email templates
properties.name: has_account

properties.description: Returns whether or not the customer is exempt from taxes
properties.name: tax_exempt

properties.description: Returns the abbreviated value of the Province/State field of the address
properties.name: province_code

properties.description: Returns the combined values of the Address1 and Address2 fields of the address
properties.name: street

properties.description: Returns the id of customer address
properties.name: id

properties.description: Returns the value of the Address1 field of the address
properties.name: address1

properties.description: Returns the value of the Address2 field of the address
properties.name: address2

properties.description: Returns the value of the City field of the address
properties.name: city

properties.description: Returns the value of the Company field of the address
properties.name: company

properties.description: Returns the value of the Country field of the address in ISO 3166-2 standard format
properties.name: country_code

properties.description: Returns the value of the Country field of the address
properties.name: country

properties.description: Returns the value of the First Name field of the address
properties.name: first_name

properties.description: Returns the value of the Last Name field of the address
properties.name: last_name

properties.description: Returns the value of the Phone field of the address
properties.name: phone

properties.description: Returns the value of the Postal/Zip field of the address
properties.name: zip

properties.description: Returns the value of the Province/State field of the address
properties.name: province

discount_allocation.description: The `discount_allocation` object contains all of the information about how a particular discount affects a line item and how the price reduces. The object can be accessed on customer order and notification templates. **Shopify Plus** merchants can also access properties of the `discount_allocation` object in the `checkout.liquid` layout file.

properties.description: The discount application that allocates the amount on the line item
properties.name: discount_application

properties.description: The discounted amount on a line item by a particular discount
properties.name: amount

discount_application.description: The `discount_application` object captures the intent of a `discount applied` on an order. The object can be accessed on customer order and notification templates. **Shopify Plus** merchants can also access properties of the discount_allocation object in the checkout.liquid layout file.

properties.description: Describes how a discount selects line items in the cart to be discounted
properties.name: target_selection

properties.description: Describes the type of item that a discount applies to. target_type has the following possible values, line_item or shipping_line
properties.name: target_type

properties.description: The customer-facing name of the discount. For example, `Welcome10` or `CBBWQQAKYBYY`
properties.name: title

properties.description: The total amount that the price of an order is reduced by the discount
properties.name: total_allocated_amount

properties.description:
The type of the discount. type has the following possible values:

- automatic
- manual
-discount_code
-script
properties.name: type

properties.description: The value of the discount.
properties.name: value

properties.description:
The value type of the discount. value_type has the following possible values:

- fixed_amount
- percentagel
properties.name: value_type

external_video.description: The external_video object can be accessed from the product object's media attribute. It contains information about a YouTube video associated with a product

properties.description: Returns the ID of the YouTube video
properties.name: external_id

properties.description: Returns the alt tag of the video set on the product details page of the Shopify admin
properties.name: alt

properties.description: Returns the aspect ratio of the YouTube video
properties.name: aspect_ratio

properties.description: Returns the media_id of the external video.
properties.name: id

properties.description: Returns the name of the video host (youtube).
properties.name: video_host

properties.description: Returns the position of the external_video in the product object's media array.
properties.name: position

properties.description: Returns the type of the object (external_video). This can be used to filter the product object's media array.
properties.name: media_type

font.description: The font object is used to access the font_picker settings. It can be accessed via the global settings object

properties.description: Returns all of the variants within the font's family. Each of the variants is also a font object
properties.name: variants

properties.description: Returns the font's name
properties.name: family

properties.description: Returns the position of the baseline within the em box (measured from the bottom). You can learn more about baseline ratios in the Plumber SASS documentation
properties.name: baseline_ratio

properties.description: Returns the selected font style
properties.name: style

properties.description: Returns the selected font weight
properties.name: weight

properties.description: Returns the suggested fallback font families
properties.name: fallback_families

form.description: The form object is used within the form tag. It contains attributes of its parent form.

properties.name: address1
properties.description: Returns the first address line associated with the address. Exclusive to form tags with the "address" parameter.

properties.name: address2
properties.description: Returns the second address line associated with the address, if it exists. Exclusive to form tags with the "address" parameter.

properties.name: author
properties.description: Returns the name of the author of the blog article comment. Exclusive to form tags with the "article" parameter.

properties.name: body
properties.description: Returns the content of the blog article comment. Exclusive to form tags with the "article" parameter.

properties.name: city
properties.description: Returns the city associated with the address. Exclusive to form tags with the "address" parameter.

properties.name: company
properties.description: Returns the company name associated with the address, if it exists. Exclusive to form tags with the "address" parameter.

properties.name: country
properties.description: Returns the country associated with the address. Exclusive to form tags with the "address" parameter.

properties.name: email
properties.description: Returns the email of the blog article comment's author. Exclusive to form tags with the "article" parameter.

properties.name: errors
properties.description:
Returns an array of strings if the form was not submitted successfully. The strings returned depend on which fields of the form were left empty or contained errors. Possible values are:

- author
- body
- email
- form

properties.name: first_name
properties.description: Returns the first name associated with the address. Exclusive to form tags with the "address" parameter.

properties.name: id
properties.description: Returns the id (unique identifier) of the form.

properties.name: last_name
properties.description: Returns the last name associated with the address. Exclusive to form tags with the "address" parameter.

properties.name: password_needed
properties.description: Used only for form tags with the "customer_login" parameter. The form.password_needed attribute always returns true.

properties.name: phone
properties.description: Returns the telephone number associated with the address, if it exists. Exclusive to form tags with the "address" parameter.

properties.name: posted_successfully?
properties.description: Returns true if the form was submitted successfully, or false if the form contained errors. All forms but the address form set that property. The address form is always submitted successfully.

properties.name: province
properties.description: Returns the province or state associated with the address. Exclusive to form tags with the "address" parameter.

properties.name: set_as_default_checkbox
properties.description: Renders an HTML checkbox that can submit the current form as the customer's default address. Exclusive to form tags with the "address" parameter

properties.name: zip
properties.description: Returns the zip code or postal code associated with the address. Exclusive to form tags with the "address" parameter.

forloop.description: The forloop object contains attributes of its parent for loop.

properties.description: Returns forloop.index in reverse order.
properties.name: rindex

properties.description: Returns forloop.index0 in reverse order.
properties.name: rindex0

properties.description: Returns the current index of the for loop, starting at 0.
properties.name: index0

properties.description: Returns the current index of the for loop, starting at 1.
properties.name: index

properties.description: Returns the number of iterations of the loop.
properties.name: length

properties.description: Returns true if it's the first iteration of the for loop. Returns false if it is not the first iteration.
properties.name: first

properties.description: Returns true if it's the last iteration of the for loop. Returns false if it is not the last iteration.
properties.name: last
fulfillment_line_items
properties.description: Returns an array of all line items and their quantity included in the fulfillment. Any line items that have already been fulfilled, or are yet to be fulfilled, will not be included in the array.

properties.name: item_count
properties.description: Returns the total number of items included in the fulfillment.

properties.name: tracking_company
properties.description: Returns the name of the fulfillment service.

properties.name: tracking_number
properties.description: Returns a fulfillment's tracking number, if it exists.

properties.name: tracking_url
properties.description: Returns the URL for a tracking number.

handle.description: Returns the handle of the page that is being viewed

image.description: The image object returns information about an image.

properties.description: Returns an array of attributes for the variant that the image is associated with.
properties.name: variants

properties.description: Returns the alt tag of the image, set in the Products page of the Admin.
properties.name: alt

properties.description: Returns the aspect ratio (width / height) of the image.
properties.name: aspect_ratio

properties.description: Returns the height of the image in pixels.
properties.name: height

properties.description: Returns the id of the image's product.
properties.name: product_id

properties.description: Returns the id of the image.
properties.name: id

properties.description: Returns the position of the image, starting at 1. This is the same as outputting forloop.index.
properties.name: position

properties.description: Returns the relative path of the product image. This is the same as outputting "{{ image }}".
properties.name: src

properties.description: Returns the width of the image in pixels.
properties.name: width

properties.description: Returns true if the image has been associated with a variant. Returns false otherwise. This can be used in cases where you want to create a gallery of images that are not associated with variants.
properties.name: attached_to_variant

images.description: Allows you to access any image in a store by its filename

linklists.description: Returns a list of all the menus (link lists) in your store. You can use linklists to access your link lists with their handles.

properties.description: Returns an array of all of the collections that a product belongs to, except any collections that are not available on the sales channel being used.
properties.name: collections

properties.description: Returns an array of all of the product's tags. The tags are returned in alphabetical order.
properties.name: tags

properties.description: Returns an array of the product's images. Use the img_url filter to link to the product image on Shopify's content delivery network (CDN).
properties.name: images

properties.description: Returns an array of the product's option names.
properties.name: options

properties.description: Returns an array of the product's options.
properties.name: options_with_values

properties.description: Returns an array of the product's variants.
properties.name: variants

properties.description: Returns the description of the product. Alias for product.description.
properties.name: content

properties.description: Returns the description of the product.
properties.name: description

properties.description: Returns the handle of a product.
properties.name: handle

properties.description: Returns the highest compare at price.
properties.name: compare_at_price_max

properties.description: Returns the highest price of the product.
properties.name: price_max

properties.description: Returns the id of the product.
properties.name: id

properties.description: Returns the lowest compare at price.
properties.name: compare_at_price_min

properties.description: Returns the lowest price of all the product's variants. This attribute is the same as product.price_min.
properties.name: price

properties.description: Returns the lowest price of the product.
properties.name: price_min

properties.description: Returns the name of the custom product template assigned to the product, without the product. prefix nor the .liquid extension. Returns nil if a custom template is not assigned to the product.
properties.name: template_suffix

properties.description: Returns the relative URL of the product's featured image.
properties.name: featured_image

properties.description: Returns the relative URL of the product.
properties.name: type

properties.description: Returns the title of the product.
properties.name: title

properties.description: Returns the variant object of the currently-selected variant if there is a valid ?variant= parameter in the URL. Returns nil if there is not.
properties.name: selected_variant

properties.description: Returns the variant object of the currently-selected variant if there is a valid ?variant= query parameter in the URL. If there is no selected variant, the first available variant is returned. In order for a variant to be available, its variant.inventory_quantity must be greater than zero or variant.inventory_policy must be set to continue. A variant with no inventory_management is considered available.
properties.name: selected_or_first_available_variant

properties.description: Returns the variant object of the first product variant that is available for purchase. In order for a variant to be available, its variant.inventory_quantity must be greater than zero or variant.inventory_policy must be set to continue. A variant with no inventory_policy is considered available.
properties.name: first_available_variant

properties.description: Returns the vendor of the product.
properties.name: vendor

properties.description: Returns true if a product is available for purchase. Returns falseif all of the products variants' inventory_quantity values are zero or less, and their inventory_policy is not set to "Allow users to purchase this item, even if it is no longer in stock."
properties.name: available

properties.description: Returns true if the compare_at_price_min is different from the compare_at_price_max. Returns false if they are the same.
properties.name: compare_at_price_varies

properties.description: Returns true if the product only has the default variant. This lets you determine whether to show a variant picker in your product forms.
properties.name: has_only_default_variant

properties.description: Returns true if the product's variants have varying prices. Returns false if all of the product's variants have the same price.
properties.name: price_varies

order.description: You can access the order object in a theme's Liquid templates with "customer.orders"

properties.name: attributes
properties.description:
Returns the custom cart attributes for the order, if there are any. You can add as many custom attributes to your cart as you like.

When you're looping through attributes, use "{{ attribute | first }}" to get the name of the attribute, and "{{ attribute | last }}" to get its value.

properties.name: billing_address
properties.description: Returns the billing address of the order.

properties.name: cancelled
properties.description: Returns true if an order is canceled, or false if it is not.

properties.name: cancelled_at
properties.description: Returns the timestamp of when an order was canceled. Use the date filter to format the timestamp.

properties.name: cancel_reason
properties.description:
Returns one of the following cancellation reasons, if an order was canceled:

-items unavailable
- fraudulent order
- customer changed/cancelled order
- other

properties.name: cancel_reason_label
properties.description: Returns the translated output of an order's order.cancel_reason.

properties.name: cart_level_discount_applications
properties.description: Returns an array of order-specific discount applications for an order.

properties.name: created_at
properties.description: Returns the timestamp of when an order was created. Use the date filter to format the timestamp.

properties.name: customer
properties.description: Returns the customer associated with the order.

properties.name: customer_url
properties.description: Returns a unique URL that the customer can use to access the order.

properties.name: discount_applications
properties.description: Returns an array of discount applications for an order.

properties.name: email
properties.description: Returns the email address associated with an order, if it exists.

properties.name: financial_status
properties.description:
Returns the financial status of an order. The possible values are:

- pending
- authorized
- paid
- partially_paid
- refunded
- partially_refunded
- voided

properties.name: financial_status_label
properties.description: Returns the translated output of an order's "financial_status".

properties.name: fulfillment_status
properties.description: Returns the fulfillment status of an order.

properties.name: fulfillment_status_label
properties.description: Returns the translated output of an order's fulfillment_status.

properties.name: line_items
properties.description: Returns an array of line items for the order.

properties.name: line_items_subtotal_price
properties.description: Returns the sum of the order's line-item prices after any line item discounts have been applied. The subtotal amount doesn't include cart discounts, taxes (unless taxes are included in the prices), or shipping costs.

properties.name: location
properties.description: (POS only) Returns the physical location of the order. You can configure locations in the Locations settings of your Shopify admin.

properties.name: name
properties.description: Returns the name of the order in the format set in the Standards and formats section of the General settings of your Shopify admin.

properties.name: note
properties.description: Returns the note associated with a customer order.

properties.name: order_number
properties.description: Returns the integer representation of the order name.

properties.name: order_status_url
properties.description: Returns the unique URL for the order status page of the order.

properties.name: phone
properties.description: Returns the phone number associated with an order, if it exists.

properties.name: shipping_address
properties.description: Returns the shipping address of the order.

properties.name: shipping_methods
properties.description: Returns an array of shipping_method variables from the order.

properties.name: shipping_price
properties.description: Returns the shipping price of an order.

properties.name: subtotal_price
properties.description: Returns the subtotal price of all the items in the order after both line-item and cart discounts have been applied. The subtotal doesn't include taxes (unless taxes are included in the prices) or shipping costs.

properties.name: tags
properties.description: Returns an array of all of the order's tags. The tags are returned in alphabetical order.

properties.name: tax_lines
properties.description: Returns an array of tax_line variables for an order.

properties.name: tax_price
properties.description: Returns the order's tax price.

properties.name: total_discounts
properties.description: Returns the total value of all discounts applied to the order.

properties.name: total_net_amount
properties.description:
Returns the net amount of the order.

The "order.total_net_amount" is calculated after refunds are applied. The value is equivalent to "order.total_price minus" "order.total_refunded_amount".

properties.name: total_price
properties.description:
Returns the total price of an order.

The "order.total_price amount" is calculated before refunds are applied. To get the value of refunds, use the "order.total_refunded_amount property."

properties.name: total_refunded_amount
properties.description: Returns the total refunded amount of an order.

properties.name: transactions
properties.description: Returns an array of transactions from the order.

section.description: The section object lets you access a section's properties and setting values.

properties.description: Returns an array of the section's blocks.
properties.name: blocks
id
properties.description: For static sections, returns the section's file name without ".liquid". For dynamic sections, returns a dynamically generated ID.

properties.name: settings
properties.description: Returns an object of the section settings set in the theme editor. Retrieve setting values by referencing the setting's unique id.

echo.description: Outputs an expression in the rendered HTML. This is identical to wrapping an expression in `{{` and `}}`, but works inside liquid tags. Filters are supported.

form.description: Creates an HTML <form> element along with the required <input> elements to submit the form to a particular endpoint.

parameters.name: address
parameters.description: The `address` object is required when editing an existing address

parameters.name: customer.new_address
parameters.description: The `customer.new_address` is required for creating a new address

parameters.name: product
parameters.description: The `product` object is required when generating a form for adding a product variant to the cart

types.description: Generates a form for activating a customer account on the activate_account.liquid template.
types.name: activate_customer_password

types.description: Generates a form for adding a product variant to the cart. Requires a "product" object as a parameter.
types.name: product

types.description: Generates a form for creating a new comment in the article.liquid template. Requires the article object as a parameter.
types.name: new_comment

types.description: Generates a form for creating a new customer account on the register.liquid template.
types.name: create_customer

types.description: Generates a form for creating a new customer without registering a new account. This form is useful for collecting customer information when you don't want customers to log in to your store, such as building a list of emails from a newsletter signup.
types.name: customer

types.description: Generates a form for creating or editing customer account addresses on the addresses.liquid template. When creating a new address, include the parameter customer.new_address. When editing an existing address, include the parameter address.
types.name: customer_address

types.description: Generates a form for logging into Customer Accounts on the login.liquid template.
types.name: customer_login

types.description: Generates a form for recovering a lost password on the login.liquid template.
types.name: recover_customer_password

types.description: Generates a form for submitting an email through the Liquid contact form.
types.name: contact

types.description: Generates a form on the customers/reset_password.liquid template for a customer to reset their password.
types.name: reset_customer_password

types.description: Generates a form on the login.liquid template that directs customers back to their checkout session as a guest instead of logging in to an account.
types.name: guest_logi n

types.description: Generates a form on the password.liquid template for entering a password-protected storefront.
types.name: storefront_password

types.description: Generates a form that lets your customer change the currency in your storefront.
types.name: currency

include.description: The include tag has been deprecated because the way that it handles variables reduces performance and makes theme code harder to both read and maintain.

layout.description: Include "{% layout 'alternate' %}" at the beginning of a template file to use an alternate layout file from the Layout folder of your theme. If you don't define an alternate layout, the theme.liquid template file is used by default:

paginate.description: Splitting products, blog articles, and search results across multiple pages is a necessary part of theme design as you are limited to 50 results per page in any for loop.

parameters.name: by
parameters.description: The by parameter is followed by an integer between 1 and 50 that tells the paginate tag how many results it should output per page.

render.description: Renders a snippet from the snippets folder of a theme.

parameters.name: for
parameters.description:
A snippet can be rendered once for each value of an enumerable object by using the `for` and `as` parameters.

When using the for parameter, the forloop object is accessible within the snippet.

parameters.name: with
parameters.description: A single object can be passed to a snippet by using the `with` and `as` parameters.

section.description: Renders a section from the sections folder of a theme.

schema.description: The javascript tag is used by Shopify sections. Each section can have a single schema tag, and schema tags must contain valid JSON. schema tags can be placed anywhere within a section file but cannot be nested inside another Liquid tag.

style.description: The Liquid style tag renders an HTML `<style>` tag with a Shopify data attribute.

stylesheet.description: The stylesheet tag is used by Shopify sections. Code is concatenated into a single file by Shopify and injected into `{{ content_for_header }}`.

types.name: scss
types.description: SASS support is used by Shopify sections. Code is concatenated into a single file by Shopify and injected into `{{ content_for_header }}`.

javascript.description: The javascript tag is used by Shopify sections. Code is concatenated into a single file by Shopify and injected into `{{ content_for_header }}`.
